description: From picaro (“adventurer, rogue”)  +‎ -esque (suffix meaning ‘in the style or manner of’ forming adjectives), modelled after Spanish picaresco (“in the style or manner of a picaro; picaresque”), from pícaro (“rogue”) + -esco (suffix forming adjectives indicating a relation). Compare French picaresque (attested later than the English word), Italian picaresco, Portuguese picaresco.

adjectives.description: picaresque (comparative more picaresque, superlative most picaresque)

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to adventurers or rogues.
(literature) Characteristic of a genre of Spanish satiric novel dealing with the adventures of a roguish hero.
